location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Sketch of the Gulf of Persia Showing the seven Classes of Jurisdictions enumerated in my letter No.67 of 13 April 1863'

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:320 x 462 mm, on sheet 346 x 495 mmFoliation:The map sheet has been foliated in the top right hand corner of the folio with a pencil number enclosed in a circle.

mods.abstract: Imprint:Lithographed in the Quarter Master Generals Office, Poona, 2 June 1863.Distinctive Features:The seven classes of jurisdiction are labelled in red ink, with their boundaries marked with red pecked lines.The map was drawn up to accompany Letter No. 67 of 1863 written by Lewis Pelly. The report along with another copy of the map can be found at Mss Eur F126/48.To the left of the map is the note: 'Durayah' (old Capital of Nejd or of the Wahabees [Wahhabis]). The present chief Town Reeas where the Ameer Hyseel resides is near Durayah'.
